wikipedia_page.main: Brian J. Bellhouse (1 October 1936 – 12 June 2017) was a British academic, engineer, and entrepreneur, the inventor of PowderJect, a needle-free injection system for delivering medications and vaccines. He was also a professor at the University of Oxford.

response: Drayson is married to Elspeth Bellhouse, the daughter of scientist Brian Bellhouse. They have five children, and live between homes in London and Nether Lypiatt Manor near Stroud in Gloucestershire, purchased for £5.75 million in 2006 from  Prince and Princess Michael of Kent.Prufrock column, The Sunday Times, 23 July 2006.

response: *PowderJect Pharmaceuticals (1993–2003) – a vaccine, drug and diagnostics delivery company founded by Brian Bellhouse.
*Brian Bellhouse, 80, British academic, engineer and entrepreneur, trampled.Multimillionaire Oxford academic Brian Bellhouse trampled to death by cows

PowderJect Pharmaceuticals was a British vaccine, drug and diagnostics delivery company founded by Brian Bellhouse.  They developed a needle-free injection system for delivering medications and vaccines.

In 2003, the company was taken over by the American Chiron Corporation for £542 million. The company's CEO was Paul Drayson, Baron Drayson, son-in-law of the founder, Brian Bellhouse, and they received £100 million following the takeover.  Drayson received £43m for his 8% holding, Bellhouse £19.5m for his 3.6% stake, and their family trusts received £41m.
In June 2017, Brian Bellhouse was trampled to death by a herd of cows in a field at Church Lane, Guestling.
* Brian Bellhouse (1937–2017), British academic, engineer, and entrepreneur
